result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Guadalupe HF.
Trial Judge - Br 7

10:48 AM Defendant Orlando L Rodriguez-Flores in court.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. Jim Larson interpreted. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim. The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
